intro: Psoralea punctata, commonly known as the spotted psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow or orange flowers clustered in dense spikes. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its leaves are compound, with small leaflets that are often covered in fine hairs. Psoralea punctata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in some African cultures for various health purposes.
